title: UK ministers are drawing up plans to evacuate 60 , 000 Britons from Israel amid fears Iran could launch an attack - with the Navy already on stand - by for a  Dunkirk - style  rescue mission to save 16 , 000 Brits stranded in Lebanon
message:
UK ministers are drawing up plans to evacuate British nationals from Israel amid fears of an attack from Iran.
The British Foreign Office is advising against all but essential travel to Israel, amid the war in Gaza, and is now looking at emergency plans to support some 60,000 Brits believed to be in the country, the Mirror reports.
Masoud Pezeshkian, the newly-elected Iranian President, has insisted his country has the 'right to respond' to the attack on Iranian soil, without specifying details.
'In essence, I think Iran and Israel would both prefer to avoid escalation out of control,' he said.
Sir Keir Starmer attempted to relay such concerns to Iran through a 'rare' phonecall to the new Iranian president on Monday.

title: This is how Israel would defend itself against new missile attacks
message:
Tensions between Iran and Israel continue to climb following the killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
Iran also said it would not send delegates to revived cease-fire talks between Hamas and Israel.
On Monday, White House officials said it was likely Iran would strike Israel in some fashion this week.
For medium- to long-range rockets, Israel deploys the David's Sling system, which it jointly developed with the U.S.
RELATED STORY | Amid heightened tensions, US deploys additional military resources to Middle EastTo combat longer-range missiles, Israel uses the Arrow system.

title: Analysis : High - wire diplomacy on possible Iran retaliation in Israel - Hamas war draws in world
message:
in Tehran, Iran, Thursday, Aug. 1, 2024.
It could also free the Israeli hostages who remain captive there since Hamas' Oct. 7 attack on southern Israel that killed 1,200 people and began the conflict.
Widespread losses could push Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's hard-line government into its own direct attack on Iran — and drag the wider Middle East into a regional war.
Its first complex attack on Israel in April caused little damage, raising the risk of it needing to go larger this time in response.
It also has backed efforts mediated by Egypt and Qatar to reach a cease-fire in the wider war.

title: UK tells UN  Palestinians have nowhere safe to turn  after Israel bombs Gaza school
message:
Speaking before the UN Security Council, August 13, the UK's Ambassador James Kariuki said: "The UK is appalled by the Israeli military strike on al-Tabeen school where Palestinian civilians were sheltering.
The UN tells us this strike killed dozens of Palestinians, many of whom are reported to be women and children.
Ambassador Kariuki continued to express the UK Government's anger at Israel's recent military actions, saying: "Palestinians have nowhere safe to turn.
"We have also heard completely unacceptable rhetoric from Israeli Ministers relating to the mistreatment of detainees and starvation of civilians in Gaza.
International law could not be more clear – systemic mistreatment of detainees and the intentional starvation of civilians are war crimes."

title: This is how Israel would defend itself against new missile attacks
message:
Tensions between Iran and Israel continue to climb following the killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
Iran also said it would not send delegates to revived cease-fire talks between Hamas and Israel.
On Monday, White House officials said it was likely Iran would strike Israel in some fashion this week.
For medium- to long-range rockets, Israel deploys the David's Sling system, which it jointly developed with the U.S.
RELATED STORY | Amid heightened tensions, US deploys additional military resources to Middle EastTo combat longer-range missiles, Israel uses the Arrow system.

title: President Joe Biden believes Iran could scrap plans to strike Israel if it agrees to ceasefire with Hamas in Gaza - 14 - Aug - 2024
message:
US President Joe Biden believes a Gaza ceasefire could be enough to convince Iran not to launch retaliatory air strikes against Israel, after the assassination of Hamas' top official in Tehran in late July.
President Biden was asked whether he expected Iran to shelve plans, if a ceasefire and hostage deal between Israel and Hamas was agreed to after talks on Thursday.
Hamas has said fresh negotiations would only serve to delay a ceasefire, and allow Israel to continue its bombardment of the war ravaged Gaza Strip.
Iran and Hezbollah planning strikes after assassinations on home soilIran and Iranian-backed Lebanese group Hezbollah are furious with Israel for two assassinations last month.
Hamas said close to 40,000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza since the war began, after around 1,100 Israelis were killed during Hamas led attacks on October 7.

title: President Joe Biden believes Iran could scrap plans to strike Israel if it agrees to ceasefire with Hamas in Gaza - 14 - Aug - 2024
message:
US President Joe Biden believes a Gaza ceasefire could be enough to convince Iran not to launch retaliatory air strikes against Israel, after the assassination of Hamas' top official in Tehran in late July.
President Biden was asked whether he expected Iran to shelve plans, if a ceasefire and hostage deal between Israel and Hamas was agreed to after talks on Thursday.
Hamas has said fresh negotiations would only serve to delay a ceasefire, and allow Israel to continue its bombardment of the war ravaged Gaza Strip.

Hamas said close to 40,000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza since the war began, after around 1,100 Israelis were killed during Hamas led attacks on October 7.

title: Palestinian death toll in Gaza nears 40 , 000 : Health authorities
message:
视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器People prepare to bury victims killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza City, on Aug. 12, 2024.
[Photo/Xinhua]The Palestinian death toll from ongoing Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip has risen to nearly 40,000, the Gaza-based health authorities said in a statement on Tuesday.
Meanwhile, seven people were killed on Tuesday after an Israeli bombing of a house in the Al-Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.
Four people were killed in an Israeli bombing on Deir al-Balah, also in the central Gaza Strip, the Palestinian official news agency WAFA reported.
On Saturday and Sunday, the Israeli military issued two new evacuation orders, primarily for areas that were previously placed under evacuation.

title: Baby twins killed in Gaza as father registered births
message:
Newborn twins were killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza while their father was at a local government office to register their birth.
The strike also killed his wife and the twins' grandmother.
An Israeli military spokesman said the school "served as an active Hamas and Islamic Jihad military facility", which Hamas denied.
Hamas-led gunmen killed about 1,200 people in an attack on Israel on 7 October, taking 251 others back to Gaza as hostages.
That attack triggered a massive Israeli military offensive on Gaza and the current war.

title: Three - month - old girl is only surviving member of family after airstrike
message:
The Israeli strike on Monday destroyed a home near the southern city of Khan Younis, killing 10 people.
Three-month-old baby Reem Abu Hayyah is the only member of her family to survive an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip late on Monday.
A few miles to the north, Mohamed Abuel-Qomasan lost his wife and their twin babies — just four days old — in another strike.
More than 10 months into its war with Hamas, Israel’s relentless bombardment of the isolated territory has wiped out extended families.
Mr Abuel-Qomasan and his wife had heeded orders to evacuate Gaza City in the opening weeks of the war.

title: A ship in the Red Sea is targeted in a third attack by suspected Houthis
message:
The ship was first attacked as an explosive was detonated near it, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The Houthis have targeted more than 70 vessels with missiles and drones since the start of the war in Gaza in October.
Other missiles and drones have been either intercepted by a U.S.-led coalition in the Red Sea or failed to reach their targets.
After the strikes, the Houthis paused their attacks until Aug. 3, when they hit a Liberian-flagged container ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden.
Additional F-22 fighter jets have flown into the region, while the USS Wasp, a large amphibious assault ship carrying F-35 fighter jets, is in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Three - month - old girl is only surviving member of family after airstrike
message:
Three-month-old baby Reem Abu Hayyah is the only member of her family to survive an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip late on Monday.
A few miles to the north, Mohamed Abuel-Qomasan lost his wife and their twin babies — just four days old — in another strike.
More than 10 months into its war with Hamas, Israel’s relentless bombardment of the isolated territory has wiped out extended families.
The Health Ministry in Gaza said 115 newborns have been killed in the territory since the war began.
Mr Abuel-Qomasan and his wife had heeded orders to evacuate Gaza City in the opening weeks of the war.

title: Gallant reveals from northern intelligence base :  We took out Hezbollah military ch
message: Gallant reveals from northern intelligence base: 'We took out Hezbollah's military chief from here'Defense minister says IDF intelligence personnel in north preparing for any potential scenario, focused on eliminating threats, all while readying all to strike wherever Israel chooses

title: Biden says Gaza ceasefire could stop Iran attacking Israel
message:
US President Joe Biden said Tuesday that a ceasefire deal in Gaza could deter Iran from attacking Israel in retaliation for the killing of a Hamas leader that sent regional tensions soaring.
Asked if a truce between Israel and Hamas could stave off an Iranian assault, Biden said: "That's my expectation".
- Far-right minister opposes talks -The United States and its European allies also called for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza, with truce talks to resume on Thursday.
"We must win and not go to the talks in Doha or Cairo," the minister said, referring to the truce talks planned for Thursday.
- Baby pulled from rubble -Despite more than 10 months of fighting in Gaza, Hamas has still on occasion been able to fire rockets into Israel.

title: 8 US Troops Treated for TBI , Smoke Inhalation After Syria Attack , Pentagon Says
message:
Eight U.S. service members were treated for traumatic brain injury and smoke inhalation after a one-way drone attack in Syria over the weekend, a Pentagon spokesperson confirmed Tuesday.
Ryder stressed that "none of the injuries are life-threatening," but provided no other details on the condition of the service members or the severity of the brain injuries.
The drone strike in Syria is the second time in recent weeks that U.S. troops in the Middle East have been injured.
Earlier this month, the Pentagon announced the USS Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group was heading to the region to replace the USS Theodore Roosevelt strike group.
Related: As Tensions Simmer in the Middle East, Pentagon Redirects Carrier Strike Group to the Area

title: Ilhan Omar wins primaries in Minnesota
message:
Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-MN) fended off several primary challengers and won the Democratic nomination for the House of Representatives in Minnesota's 5th Congressional District, NBC News projected.
Omar defeated former Minneapolis City Councilman Don Samuels, who lost to the congresswoman by just 2 percentage points in the 2022 primary, and two other challengers.
In late June, group member Jamaal Bowman lost his Democratic primary in New York to Westchester County Executive George Latimer.
Omar did not face an onslaught of attack ads from outside groups as did the other candidates from “The Squad” who were defeated in their primaries.
Omar has recently come under fire again for her condemnation of Israel’s actions in the war against Hamas.

title: Biden expects Iran not to attack if a ceasefire is reached
message:
US President Joe Biden said Tuesday that he expects Iran to back down from its threats to attack Israel if a ceasefire deal with Hamas is reached this week.
“That’s my expectation,” Biden told reporters when asked if he believes Iran will not strike if a deal is signed.
We believe getting to a ceasefire deal is the best way to de-escalate the tensions that we’re seeing,” Jean-Pierre told reporters.
Iran has threatened for the last two weeks to retaliate for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran on July 31.
Israeli and US officials have stated that they believe an Iranian attack on Israel could happen in the coming days.

title: Latest Israeli Attacks on Gaza Kill 32 Palestinians ; Hamas Says Hostages Killed , Wounded
message:
By Democracy NowHAVANA TIMES – Israel’s assault on the Gaza Strip continues, with at least 32 more Palestinians killed in the past 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry in Gaza.
One overnight strike by Israel on a home in Khan Younis killed 10 Palestinians and wounded several others.
Another Israeli attack leveled a residential building in Gaza City, burying residents in their homes.
We came to see what had happened, and we found that the Israeli military had hit the building.
Meanwhile, the United Nations Security Council is set to meet today in the wake of Saturday’s devastating Israeli airstrike on a school in Gaza City that killed over 100 Palestinians.

title: Pentagon says an attack by Iran on Israel is  certainly possible  this week :  We need to take it seriously
message:
Pentagon says an attack by Iran on Israel is 'certainly possible' this week: ‘We need to take it seriously'A Pentagon spokesperson told reporters on Tuesday that an attack by Iran on Israel is "certainly possible" this week, adding that the threat needs to be taken seriously, so more resources are being maneuvered to the region.
"Is an attack possible this week?
That’s certainly possible," Ryder said.
US MILITARY EXPANDS PRESENCE IN MIDDLE EAST, REPOSITIONS FORCES AS REGIONAL TENSIONS SIMMERPentagon Press Secretary Maj. Gen. Pat Ryder said an attack by Iran is "certainly possible" this week.
Original article source: Pentagon says an attack by Iran on Israel is 'certainly possible' this week: ‘We need to take it seriously'

title: Officials head to Middle East for Gaza ceasefire talks in race to stop conflict from spreading
message:
The ceasefire talks, which are set to take place in Doha, Qatar, or Cairo, were expected to include top intelligence officials from Egypt, Israel and the United States, as well as the Qatari Prime Minister.
Hamas leaders have not met directly with Israeli officials throughout the war, relying on Qatar and Egypt to act as intermediaries.
But Mr. Netanyahu has added new conditions to Israel’s demands that his own negotiators fear have created obstacles to a deal, according to unpublished documents reviewed by The New York Times.
They said they were willing to present a “final bridging proposal” to close a deal between Israel and Hamas.
Israel has not acknowledged that it was behind the explosion, but U.S. officials have privately assessed that it was.

title: Three - month - old girl is only surviving member of family after airstrike
message:
A few miles to the north, Mohamed Abuel-Qomasan lost his wife and their twin babies — just four days old — in another strike.
More than 10 months into its war with Hamas, Israel’s relentless bombardment of the isolated territory has wiped out extended families.
The dead included Reem Abu Hayyah’s parents and five siblings, ranging in age from five to 12, as well as the parents of three other children.
His wife Joumana Arafa, a pharmacist, had given birth four days ago and announced the twins’ arrival on Facebook.
Mr Abuel-Qomasan and his wife had heeded orders to evacuate Gaza City in the opening weeks of the war.

title: Fearing Iran attack , Israeli museum hides top artworks
message:
A sign leads visitors to a "protected space" at the Tel Aviv Museum of Art in Tel Aviv on Tuesday.
-- AFPPublished: Wed 14 Aug 2024, 7:16 AMAn Israeli museum that hid some of its most valuable artworks after the October 7 attack has now stashed away even more, fearing a strike by Iran.
Paintings by Pablo Picasso and Gustav Klimt are among the treasures moved by Tel Aviv Museum of Art to the "safe" -- a secured basement meant to shield them from missiles.
Museum staff moved many of the masterpieces at the start of the Gaza war, which was triggered by the Palestinian group Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israeli soil on October 7.
"So we took down several other works of art and the ones we felt that were most in danger.

title: WATCH : Possible lightning bolt causes spark , dirt explosion outside Florida home
message:
Earlier this week, a Florida homeowner's security camera appeared to capture a powerful lightning strike, causing a loud boom, and apparently sending dirt flying into the air.
David Houghton, who lives in Ocoee, Florida, shared the video with FOX 35.
They assumed it was a lightning strike.
FOX 35 went through frame by frame.
He said it also signifies the importance that there is no safe spot outside when lightning is around and that lightning can strike anywhere.

title: Israeli strikes on Gaza leave orphans , childless parents
message:
It has left parents without children and children without parents or siblings.
The Israeli strike late Monday destroyed a home near the southern city of Khan Younis, killing 10 people.
The dead included Abu Hayyah’s parents and five siblings, ranging in age from 5 to 12, as well as the parents of three other children.

title: Israeli strikes on Gaza leave children without parents and parents without children
message:
Israeli strikes on Gaza leave children without parents and parents without childrenDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Reem Abu Hayyah, just three months old, was the only member of her family to survive an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip late Monday.
It has left parents without children and children without parents or siblings.
The dead included Abu Hayyah's parents and five siblings, ranging in age from 5 to 12, as well as the parents of three other children.
Around 84% of Gaza's territory has been placed under evacuation orders by the Israeli military, according to the United Nations.
Abuel-Qomasan and his wife had heeded orders to evacuate Gaza City in the opening weeks of the war.

title: Israeli strikes on Gaza leave children without parents and parents without children
message:
(AP Photo/Abdel Kareem Hana)DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — Reem Abu Hayyah, just three months old, was the only member of her family to survive an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip late Monday.
It has left parents without children and children without parents or siblings.
The dead included Abu Hayyah’s parents and five siblings, ranging in age from 5 to 12, as well as the parents of three other children.
Mohammad Abu Al-Qumsan, Center, prays next to the bodies of his 4-day-old twin children, killed in the Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip, at a hospital in Deir al-Balah, Tuesday, Aug. 13, 2024.
Abuel-Qomasan and his wife had heeded orders to evacuate Gaza City in the opening weeks of the war.

title: Hezbollah launches rockets towards N . Israel - World News
message:
Earlier, Hezbollah had launched over 20 rockets from southern Lebanon at the Meron base in northern Israel, both al-Manar and Al Jazeera have reported.
Israeli warplanes launched airstrikes targeting the Lebanese villages of At Tiri, Haddatha, and Rchaf around midnight, NNA added.
Israeli warplanes also conducted airstrikes on the Lebanese villages of Kafr Kila and Khiam, as well as the municipality of Kunin, it noted.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on October 8, 2023, following a barrage of rockets launched by the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah toward Israel in solidarity with Hamas' attack on Israel the day before.
Hezbollah Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah threatened a definite and painful response to the Israeli raid at the appropriate time and place.

title: Hezbollah launches rockets towards Israel
message:
Beirut: Hezbollah attacked the Mount Neria base, a battalion leadership headquarters of Israel’s Golani Brigade forces, with volleys of Katyusha rockets late Tuesday night, according to state media.
Earlier, Hezbollah had launched more than 20 rockets from southern Lebanon at the Meron base in northern Israel, both al-Manar and Al Jazeera have reported.
Israeli warplanes launched airstrikes targeting the Lebanese villages of At Tiri, Haddatha, and Rchaf around midnight, NNA added.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on October 8, 2023, following a barrage of rockets launched by the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah toward Israel in solidarity with Hamas’ attack on Israel on October 7.
Hezbollah Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah threatened a definite and painful response to the Israeli raid at the appropriate time and place.

title: Gaza ceasefire : Hamas says again it wants implementation , not more talks
message:
Two rockets had been fired from Gaza, the Israeli military said, one of which fell in the sea and the other had not reached Israeli territory.
Israeli airstrikes killed 19 Palestinians in the central and southern Gaza Strip on Tuesday, medics said.
The Israeli military and Islamic Jihad and Hamas said they were fighting in several areas of Gaza.
Ceasefire talksThe US said on Monday that it expected Gaza ceasefire talks slated for Thursday to go ahead as planned, and that an agreement was still possible.
But Hamas is demanding a workable plan to implement the proposal, presented by US President Joe Biden in May — rather than more talks.

title: Woman violently attacked at Pasadena Metro station faces  long - term disfigurement , officials say
message:
The woman violently attacked at a Pasadena Metro station and dragged onto the 210 Freeway is facing "long-term disfigurement," officials said Tuesday.
The victim was at the Allen Metro station near Pasadena City College early Wednesday morning when a man approached her and, out of the blue, struck her in the face, authorities said.
The damage to her head and face was severe enough that "there is potential for long-term disfigurement," the department said.
Juan Pablo Flores, 33, was arrested Wednesday around 5:45 a.m., shortly after the attack occurred, the L.A. County district attorney's office said Monday.
Sign up for Essential California for news, features and recommendations from the L.A. Times and beyond in your inbox six days a week.

title: Over 1 , 000 arrested following united kingdom disorder : police
message:
—ReutersRiots started following death of three girls in stabbing.
UK police have arrested over 1,000 people in connection with riots that took place over the last two weeks in England, officials said on Tuesday.
"Forces across the country have now made more than 1,000 arrests in connection with the recent violent disorder," the National Police Chiefs’ Council (NPCC) said on X.
Far-right riots took place after misinformation spread about the identity of the alleged perpetrator of the knife attack, with multiple people being jailed for spreading hate online in recent days.
One man, John Honey, pleaded guilty to helping attack a car with three Romanian men in it and assaulting police during riots in Hull, northeast England.

title: Only Gaza ceasefire can delay Iran Israel response
message:
Three regional government sources described conversations with Tehran to avoid escalation ahead of the Gaza ceasefire talks, due to begin on Thursday in either Egypt or Qatar.
"We hope our response will be timed and executed in a way that does not harm a potential ceasefire," Iran's mission to the U.N. said on Friday in a statement.

title: Iran Rejects Western Plea to Drop Israel Retaliation Threats
message:
Iran on Tuesday categorically refused Western calls to drop its threat to retaliate against Israel for last month’s killing of Hamas terrorist leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
Israel has been blamed for Haniyeh’s killing on July 31 during a visit to the Iranian capital for the swearing-in of President Masoud Pezeshkian.
Iran has since been publicly vowing revenge and on Monday key Western allies urged it to reconsider, as Breitbart News reported.
The United States has deployed an aircraft carrier strike group and a guided missile submarine to the region in support of Israel.
“Such a request lacks political logic, flies in the face of the principles and rules of international law, and constitutes public and practical support” for Israel.

title: Bombing Putin palace or seizing an even greater prize : Ukraine invasion of Russia puts the end within reach , writes MARK ALMOND
message:
In the last few weeks, Kyiv had been signalling it was open to peace talks with Moscow; not to surrender but to arrange an honourable settlement that preserves the country’s independence and recovers as much ground as possible.
A week ago, an elite Ukrainian unit stormed the border and its forces have since seized some 400 square miles of Russian territory in the Kursk region.
It appears that the Ukrainians have adopted the great Soviet art of ‘maskirovka’ – deception in warfare – and taught Putin a lesson in over-confidence.
The invasion of Kursk in particular, the first foreign incursion into Russia since the Second World War, will have hurt Putin.
That war ended in total victory, but this war will end with a messy compromise.

title: Former member of Japanese germ - warfare unit exposes war crimes in China - China . org . cn
message:
With black background and white characters, the inscription on the monument reads: "The Japanese Army's Unit 731 committed unprecedented national crimes in world history in China."
Standing in front of the monument, Shimizu put his palms together and bowed deeply.
On Tuesday afternoon, Shimizu visited the Exhibition Hall of Evidences of Crime Committed by Unit 731 of the Japanese Imperial Army.
Unit 731 was a top-secret biological and chemical warfare research base established in Harbin as the nerve center for Japanese biological warfare in China and Southeast Asia during World War II.
At least 3,000 people were used in human experiments by Unit 731, while more than 300,000 people in China were killed by Japan's biological weapons.

title: Kennedy confirmed as Air Force cyber boss
message:
WASHINGTON — The Senate confirmed a new leader for the U.S. Air Force’s information warfare branch, the latest move in a shuffling of cybersecurity leadership in the military.
Air Force Maj. Gen. Kevin Kennedy was approved by voice vote to head up the 16th Air Force (Air Forces Cyber) and receive his third star on June 23, roughly one month after President Joe Biden nominated him.
The 16th Air Force was created in late 2019, after the service combined and deactivated the 24th Air Force and the 25th Air Force.
The 16th Air Force is an amalgam of cyber, electronic warfare, intelligence and weather disciplines.
Senators this year also confirmed a new head for Army Cyber Command as well as a new chief of Navy Fleet Cyber Command.

title: Japanese veteran testifies to Unit 731 crimes , apologizes
message:
"I would like to express my sincere apologies and repentance to the Chinese victims, the victims of Unit 731, and the deceased," he said.
Shimizu was about 14 years old and among the last batches of Unit 731 Youth Corps members when he was sent to Harbin in March 1945.
He spent more than four months witnessing the war crimes committed by his unit, including the cultivation of pathogens, human dissections and experiments on humans.
At least 3,000 people were used for human experiments by Unit 731, and more than 300,000 people across China were killed by Japan's biological weapons.
Before leaving China, Unit 731 tried to gun down all survivors and destroy incriminating evidence of the atrocities it committed.

title: Russia Aspirational Grom Combat Drone Design Totally Changes , Ditches Stealth For Speed
message:
A new Russian design for a ‘loyal wingman’-type supersonic drone has been unveiled, marking the country’s latest foray into unmanned combat air vehicles (UCAVs).
A new Russian design concept for a ‘loyal wingman’-type drone has been unveiled, marking the country’s latest aspirational foray into unmanned combat air vehicles (UCAVs).
A mockup of the new Grom drone is on display at the Army 2024 defense exhibition that is taking place in the Moscow region from August 12 to 14.
@MuxelAeroOverall, the design of the new-look Grom appears to be optimized for high speed and maneuverability, rather than low observability and endurance.
Nonetheless, the dramatic changes in the appearance of the drone concept are interesting in themselves and may well reflect broader changes in Russia’s concept of how future advanced unmanned combat air vehicles should be employed.

title: Georgia Sen . Jon Ossoff says there progress in efforts to bring a new fighter squadron to Moody Air Force Base
message:
“It is a big deal to have the Chief of Staff of the United States Air Force in Georgia,” Ossoff said during a press conference at Moody.
Ten other bases already operate the model, as the Air Force moves from legacy systems to new systems, phasing out the A-10 “Warthog” model designed for close air support.
The A-10 “has been part of the backbone of the Air Force since the Cold War, but the reality is that the air defense threats that our Air Force will face moving forward put the A-10 at risk, and so the Air Force has to innovate,” Ossoff said.
The Southern Georgia base employs approximately 5,000 military and civilian personal, according to a DOD website.
“The airmen, the service members and the Department of Defense, civilians and contractors who work here at Moody Air Force Base are 100% committed to our national security — they’ve given their careers to it,” Ossoff said.

title: How Hernán Cortés Conquered the Aztec Empire
message:
How did Cortés manage to overthrow the seat of the Aztec Empire?
When Spanish conquistadors arrived in the Aztec imperial city in 1519, Mexico-Tenochtitlán was led by Moctezuma II.
Hernándo Cortés Makes Allies with Local TribesUniversal History Archive/Getty Images Hernándo Cortés, Spanish conquistador who conquered Mexico, with Moctezuma II, last Aztec emperor, 1519.
Leaving his top lieutenant Pedro de Alvarado in charge of Tenochtitlán, Cortés took men to attack the Spanish forces at the coast.
In Cortés' absence, Alvarado had hundreds of Aztec nobles killed during a ceremonial feast, leading to further unrest among the Aztec people.

title: Palestinian Christians Plea With the Global Church to Stand With Them
message:

title: Airpower History Tour coming to Colorado Springs
message:
(COLORADO SPRINGS) — The Airpower History Tour is coming to the Colorado Springs Airport from Wednesday, Aug. 28, to Sunday, Sept. 1, bringing the sights, sounds, and stories of World War II (WWII) aviation to life when the B-29 Superfortress “FIFI” along with a T-6 Texan and an RC-45J Expeditor land.
The event, which tours airports across North America, is presented by the Commemorative Air Force (CAF).
Visitors will have the opportunity to view all aircraft up close, purchase rides, and tour the B-29 cockpit in between flights.
It is known as the aircraft that helped bring the war to an end with its mission flying over Japan.
The CAF has become the world’s largest flying museum, collecting and flying WWII aircraft for over six decades.

message:
Russia says it thwarted a Ukrainian charge to expand its incursion.
Meanwhile, Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesman Heorhii Tykhyi said the cross-border operation was aimed at protecting Ukrainian land from long-range strikes launched from Kursk.
He said Russia had launched more than 2,000 strikes from the Kursk region in recent months using anti-aircraft missiles, artillery, mortars, drones, 255 glide bombs and more than 100 missiles.
Ukraine's undermanned army has struggled to hold back the bigger, better-equipped Russian forces in Donetsk.
The goals of the swift advance into the Kursk region have been a closely guarded military secret.

title: Russia says it thwarted a Ukrainian charge to expand its incursion . Kyiv says it wont occupy land
message:
Russia says it thwarted a Ukrainian charge to expand its incursion.
Meanwhile, Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesman Heorhii Tykhyi said the cross-border operation was aimed at protecting Ukrainian land from long-range strikes launched from Kursk.
He said Russia had launched more than 2,000 strikes from the Kursk region in recent months using anti-aircraft missiles, artillery, mortars, drones, 255 glide bombs and more than 100 missiles.
Ukraine's undermanned army has struggled to hold back the bigger, better-equipped Russian forces in Donetsk.
The goals of the swift advance into the Kursk region have been a closely guarded military secret.

title: Oil Theft : Reps Seek Special Fund For NSCDC , Customs
message:
The House of Representatives Special Committee on Oil Theft/Losses has called for a particular intervention fund to enable the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) and Nigeria Customs Service (NCS) to perform optimally.
Alhasan Ado Doguwa, said this on Tuesday during a special session/hearing on the Use of Special Intervention Funds to Combat crude oil theft in the country.
The chairman promised to ensure that the NSCDC is fully involved in the war against oil theft and losses in Nigeria.
The Commandant General of NSCDC, Ahmed Audi, said the Corps‘ core mandate is to protect critical national assets and infrastructure across the Country.
Represented by his deputy, Philip Ayuba, the Commandant General also said the corps has been unable to fully access the special intervention fund from any agencies to carry out its mandates.

title: Veterans Will Not Be Fooled By Tim Walz
message:
But vets know what they see when they look at this guy and it’s not good.
He was a senior noncommissioned officer—a high-ranking sergeant who was frocked as a command sergeant major.
You need to understand what a command sergeant major is.
He wasn’t an actual command sergeant major either, only holding the rank temporarily contingent on passing the Sergeant Majors Academy course.
The command sergeant major is supposed to take care of them.

title: China Is in Denial About the War in Ukraine
message:
China has, in fact, incurred costs as a result of Putin’s war and Beijing’s economic and diplomatic support for it.
These blind spots matter because in China, the war in Ukraine is serving as both an observatory and a laboratory as the country prepares for heightened geopolitical conflict with the United States.
That effort offered a “vivid demonstration of the tools of economic power” that the United States could muster, Li wrote.
Although Western sanctions have not broken the Russian economy, the war in Ukraine has spurred further global economic fragmentation.
Russia’s war on Ukraine offers general lessons about the complexities of modern warfare, the possibilities for an international response to a purportedly regional dispute, and the costs of a protracted military conflict.

title: Russia says it thwarted expanding Ukrainian charge
message:
KYIV, Ukraine — Russia said Tuesday its forces checked an effort by Ukrainian troops to expand a stunning weeklong incursion into the Kursk region, as a Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesman said Kyiv has no intention of occupying Russian territory.
Meanwhile, Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesman Heorhii Tykhyi said the cross-border operation was aimed at protecting Ukrainian land from long-range strikes launched from Kursk.
He said Russia launched more than 2,000 strikes from the Kursk region in recent months using anti-aircraft missiles, artillery, mortars, drones, 255 glide bombs and more than 100 missiles.
Ukraine's undermanned army has struggled to hold back the bigger, better-equipped Russian forces in Donetsk.
The goals of the swift advance into the Kursk region were a closely guarded military secret.

title: Ukraine deals blow to Putin narrative with Kursk offensive
message:
Russian forces are struggling to beat back Ukrainian troops who are now digging into the territory they grabbed in a widely praised counteroffensive.
Though the country lowered the draft age earlier this year, it will take time to replenish troops, and that could impact Ukraine’s ability to hold territory in Kursk.
Kursk borders the northeastern Ukrainian region of Sumy, which neighbors Ukraine’s Kharkiv province, where Russian forces are still trying to advance.
“Unlike Russia, Ukraine doesn’t need something that belongs to someone else,” he said in remarks shared by state-run media.
And we will find another weak point in [the] Russian border, and will attack.”Copyright 2024 Nexstar Media, Inc. All rights reserved.
